subtitle: Flat bread made from wholemeal flour, fried in butter or ghee.

method.text: Sift the flour and salt together. Make a well in the centre. Gradually add enough waer to make a soft dough. Knead well until no longer sticky.
On a floured surface, roll each ball into an 18 cm/7in round.
Gently heat a frying pan. Place a round of dough onto the pan. When litle rown specks appear on the underside, turn over and cook briefly on the other side.
Flip over again and, with a clean tea towel, press gently to circulate steam all around, until underside is golden brown. Do the same on the other side.
Remove and place on a plate.
Brush melted butter (or ghee) over the top. Place in a covered container.
Repeat with remaining dough rounds and stack on top of each other.
